item.title: Family that used potentially asbestos-contaminated coloured sand at Diwali want clear action points
item.description: A Canberra mother who used coloured sand to celebrate Diwali in her backyard wants more help from WorkSafe ACT after being advised to cordon off the area, a thoroughfare to her home, and call an asbestos company.

item.title: Government canvasses Pacific leaders on backdown option for COP31
item.description: The federal government has begun to contact Pacific leaders to canvass a COP31 "Plan B" which would see Adelaide abandon its bid for the global United Nations climate summit so long as Pacific nations are guaranteed a role in next year's conference.

item.title: ARIA Awards 2025 winners: Amyl & The Sniffers and Ninajirachi dominate
item.description: The ARIAs belonged to two relative underdogs this year. Don't know who they are? It's time to pay attention.

item.title: Sussan Ley to call for urgent action on defence in Menzies Institute speech
item.description: The opposition leader will pledge to spend 3 per cent of GDP on defence during a speech at the Menzies Institute in Melbourne on Thursday.

item.title: Fire kills at least one person and damages 170 buildings in city of Oita in Japan
item.description: Authorities are still working to extinguish the blaze, which has spread to nearby woodland.

item.title: The EU's been accused of caving to big tech on AI regulation. Here's why
item.description: Artificial intelligence could be trained using the sensitive health data of European citizens under proposed changes to the EU's rules on the sector.

item.title: UK 'ready to act' as Russian spy ship nears British territory
item.description: The Russian vessel had directed lasers at pilots of surveillance aircraft monitoring its activities.

item.title: CSIRO cuts highlight which jobs government protects in national interest
item.description: The prime minister, when in opposition, accused the Coalition of "hollowing out" the CSIRO. Now, following the announcement 350 research positions at the organisation will be cut, he is being accused of being "worse than Abbott".

item.title: Cricket Tasmania and stadium proponent say they've found a solution to roof concerns
item.description: Cricket Tasmania and the Macquarie Point stadium proponent believe they have found the solution to concerns about how the stadium's roof could affect cricket.

item.title: Home owners say insurance firms failing to pay plumbing works claims
item.description: Home owners are demanding action after years trying to access insurance payouts for failed plumbing work that has left properties a mess and, in some cases, unliveable.

item.title: Coloured sand recall to cost Stroud after-school care operator thousands of dollars for small clean-up
item.description: A regional NSW after-school hours operator says an asbestos removal company wanted to charge her more than $14,000 to vacuum up a small amount of coloured sand that spilled onto a carpet.

item.title: UWU boss Tim Kennedy accused of 'misleading' members about links to slush fund
item.description: The head of one of Australia's most powerful unions has suffered a vote of no confidence amid claims he was aware of allegedly improper use of members' resources to raise money from bosses for an election slush fund.

item.title: New mining laws frustrate farmers but mining companies say they are a step forward
item.description: South Australia's mining minister now has the power to extend mining leases, which farmers say makes the future of their land "uncertain".

item.title: Cyclone Fina tracker map: Where the cyclone is now and when it will hit NT coastline
item.description: Tropical Cyclone Fina, currently packing sustained winds of 95 kilometres per hour near its centre, is expected to turn south towards the Top End coast today.

item.title: FOI data shows Australian mining and manufacturing sectors take months to detect cyber breaches
item.description: Australia's mining and manufacturing sectors are taking up to two years to notice and report cyber breaches to authorities, prompting concerns about the data security of industries critical to the nation's economy.

item.title: Nangs to be seized under new Queensland laws cracking down on sale of illegal tobacco and nicotine
item.description: Nitrous oxide bulbs and canisters, known colloquially as nangs, can lead to paralysis when consumed in large quantities over an extended period of time.

item.title: England names Jofra Archer and Mark Wood in squad for first Ashes Test
item.description: England is yet to confirm its final XI, but damaging fast bowlers Jofra Archer and Mark Wood may team up to take on Australia in Perth.

item.title: Wicked: For Good captures the spirit of the stage musical’s second act — for better and for worse
item.description: Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo shine in Wicked: For Good, but does the sequel live up to the thrill of its predecessor?

item.title: Calls for NSW Police to end high-speed pursuits for minor offences after crash deaths
item.description: Harri Jokinen is one of several people who died from accidents during pursuits involving NSW Police.

item.title: Hunt for man who stole car with baby inside from Shepparton supermarket car park
item.description: Police search for a man who stole a car with a sleeping baby in the back seat from a supermarket car park in northern Victoria, before dumping the child in a box and driving away.

item.title: NSW government refuses to lift licence restriction until Tahmoor Coal pays $29.4 million royalty debt
item.description: A restriction on Tahmoor Coal's licence will not be removed until $29.4 million in outstanding royalties are paid to the NSW government.

item.title: NT prepares for Tropical Cyclone Fina as it tracks towards coast
item.description: Residents along the NT coast are preparing for a rare November cyclone to make landfall on Saturday by cutting down tree branches, stocking up on goods and making decisions about where to bunker down.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Stronger Tasmanian dog welfare laws to help prevent puppy farms
item.description: A position paper sets out limits for breeders and proposes an information sharing system for better regulation.

item.title: These semi-pros are changing the face of international football
item.description: Although only semi-professional footballers, these players are helping reshape the face of the game for less-established football nations, while representing their heritage.

item.title: Alternative protein sector expected to triple worldwide by 2032 but struggles for investment
item.description: The world is facing a crisis in food production and alternative sources of protein can be part of the solution, but the fledgling Australian sector is struggling.

item.title: Sam Kerr set to be fit for Matildas internationals against New Zealand despite Chelsea omission
item.description: Sam Kerr will miss Chelsea's Women's Champions League match against Barcelona on Friday, just days after her club manager said she was likely to play.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Police pulling Aboriginal teenager from bus at gunpoint was 'racial profiling', family alleges
item.description: The family of a 17-year-old Indigenous boy says he was racially profiled when he was pulled from a Canberra bus by police officers who handcuffed him before realising he was the wrong person.

item.title: Kempsey to host New South Wales first trial of in-home mental health treatment service
item.description: NSW will run a state-first trial that will offer mental health patients care in their own home, but it will mean the town trialling the system loses its hospital-based mental health unit.

item.title: Cyclone Fina to hit NT between Cape Don and Maningrida from late Friday
item.description: The BOM's latest track map shows Tropical Cyclone Fina has been temporarily downgraded to a category one system, but could still intensify to a category three by Saturday afternoon.

item.title: G20 leaders are 'saving the furniture' as Trump leads a boycott
item.description: Trump's absence could neuter the forum's ability to move the dial on the summit's priorities, including helping nations adapt to weather disasters, the transition to clean energy, cutting excessive debt costs and working together in the global rush for critical minerals.

item.title: Reserve prices to be published under Victorian government underquoting crackdown
item.description: Real estate agents in Victoria will be required to publish a property's reserve price at least seven days before it goes to auction, under new laws the state government says will stamp out illegal underquoting.

item.title: Australia hands COP31 to Türkiye but Chris Bowen to lead negotiations
item.description: Adelaide will not host next year's COP summit, but Australia's energy minister, Chris Bowen, will lead the negotiations, and a pre-event will be hosted by a Pacific Island nation.

item.title: Is it possible to build a flood-proof house on the banks of the Brisbane River?
item.description: Only someone whose family has long lived next to a river famous for catastrophic flooding would dare to build on this block. Here's what we can all learn from Richard and Janette's new home.

item.title: Blaithin Mackin loves playing Gaelic and AFLW but it means living a double life
item.description: Melbourne premiership player Blaithin Mackin loves playing both Gaelic and AFLW — but it means living a double life.

item.title: Donald Trump signs Epstein files bill into law, triggering 30-day deadline for document release
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he has signed off on legislation to force the release of the "Epstein files" — the final step required to turn the bill into law.

item.title: Kumanjayi White's family says NT DPP too slow to deliver death in custody findings
item.description: Kumanjayi White investigation continues six months on from his death as the Department of Public Prosecutions awaits "the provision of further material" from NT Police. But the family says the findings are taking too long.

item.title: Boy escapes attempted abduction by man in balaclava in northern NSW
item.description: A school community in northern NSW is warned to remain vigilant after a child of about 12 was approached by a man wearing a balaclava and gloves.

item.title: Australia names first Ashes Test team, with Jake Weatherald and Brendan Doggett set to debut in Perth
item.description: Australia is set to blood two debutants in a Test for the first time since 2019 as the Ashes get underway in Perth on Friday.

item.title: Chun Lai Yuen pleads guilty after Burswood car cruise crash that seriously injured Caitlyn Dickson
item.description: A Chinese national admits dangerous driving over a "horrific" crash at a car club meet-up that left 17-year-old Caitlyn Dickson with life-threatening injuries.

item.title: Teenager sentenced to at least 13 years' prison for unprovoked murder of Ethan Hoac
item.description: The killer of Ethan Hoac — who was murdered in an unprovoked attack in Melbourne's north-west in 2023 — is sentenced to more than a decade behind bars for a crime labelled "appalling" and "vicious".

item.title: Mexican woman jailed in connection with killings of Australian surfers Jake and Callum Robinson
item.description: A woman has been sentenced to 20 years in jail for her role in a robbery in which three men, including two Australian brothers, were killed in Mexico last year.

item.title: The big names and shows coming to the ABC in 2026, from Julia Morris in Class Clowns to Guy Sebastian in The Piano
item.description: Stars including Anne Edmonds, Sam Pang and Shaun Tan are attached to the ABC's 2026 line-up with old audience favourites and new series coming next year.

item.title: Upgrades to WA public transport payment system to be rolled out in early December
item.description: After delays and budget blowouts, Perth commuters will be able to use credit cards, phones and smart watches to swipe onto public transport and pay for their fares from December 8.

item.title: Hotels 'disappointed' by COP31 loss, but SA Premier suggests future bid
item.description: South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas has not given up hope for Adelaide to potentially host the UN climate summit in the future, after Australia ceded the hosting rights for next year's event to Türkiye.

item.title: Joe Root's century drought in Australia could end this Ashes — but where is it most likely to happen?
item.description: He's one of the best batters in the world right now, but Joe Root is yet to score a century on Australian soil — can he finally end that drought this summer?

item.title: EPA investigating after hundreds of fish found dead in Victoria's Tarwin River
item.description: The Environment Protection Authority investigates the death of hundreds of fish in the Tarwin River in Victoria's South Gippsland.

item.title: Why celebrity scandals can leave us feeling shattered
item.description: Whether it's controversy around a jeans ad, voting for a political party you disagree with, or criminal allegations, it can feel confronting to learn more about a person you admire.

item.title: Narco subs appear in Pacific amid warnings cartels are ramping up trafficking to Australia
item.description: The discovery of narco subs bearing the hallmarks of boats used by Mexican and South American drug cartels has intensified warnings that international syndicates are increasingly targeting the lucrative Australian and New Zealand illicit drug markets.

item.title: Mother allegedly locked manslaughter victim in alarmed room, neglect trial hears
item.description: A mother standing trial for the alleged criminal neglect and manslaughter of her daughter made the girl hit herself, locked her in an alarmed room and cut off most of her hair, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm, which may be distressing to readers.

item.title: Environmental, noise impacts from Burswood racetrack plan not significant, EPA decides
item.description: The path is cleared for a controversial racetrack to be built in Perth after Western Australia's environmental watchdog decides against launching a formal project assessment.

item.title: Albanese cops summit loss, Liberals go hunting and Hanson gets cooking
item.description: The prime minister didn't seem too bothered as he sold Australia losing out on the rights to host a major climate summit as a win.

item.title: Anti-corruption police raid APY Lands administration office in Umuwa
item.description: South Australia police say several searches have been carried out on multiple premises in the Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Lands, including the administration offices in Umuwa.

item.title: England wicketkeeper Jamie Smith could be the tourists' unlikely Ashes secret weapon
item.description: England's wicketkeeper for the Ashes series may look unassuming but as Russell Jackson writes, if Australia underestimates Jamie Smith, they will do so at their peril.

item.title: How politicians could combat doubts about Epstein files release
item.description: As a 30-day timer begins for the US Department of Justice to release its Epstein files, questions remain around whether this will be the definitive release.

item.title: Daly Cherry-Evans unveiling as a Sydney Rooster is a look into a strange new world
item.description: After a rugby league lifetime in maroon and white, Daly Cherry-Evans pulled on his new colours for the first time, and the veteran's move to the Sydney Roosters was a look into an uncanny valley beyond.

item.title: Federal government funding extends cohealth GP services until July 2026
item.description: The Commonwealth will provide $1.5 million in temporary funding to keep the community health clinic's GP services running until July next year.

item.title: Councillors oust Sue Scarman as mayor of Northern Areas Council
item.description: With 12 months still left of her term, a well-known South Australian mayor has been ousted by fellow councillors, but she has challenged them to offer a "legitimate reason" for her dismissal.

item.title: AFL draft 2025 night two recap: Archie Ludowkye gives up hope of being picked and misses drafting moment
item.description: Archie Ludowyke goes to his bedroom thinking he is not going to get his AFL dream realised, only to to hear an eruption from his living room as his name is called out by the Adelaide Crows.

item.title: Queensland aquaculture company and CEO fined $300k for illegal barramundi farm
item.description: The company was sentenced to pay the fine, with the chief executive also given a $60,000 penalty as well as payment of court costs for the environmental breach.

item.title: EU 'optimistic' about breakthrough in free trade agreement negotiations with Australia
item.description: A breakthrough in long-stalled negotiations over a free trade deal between Australia and the European Union could come as soon as this weekend, sources have told the ABC.

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Surfing pioneer Kevin Merifield hangs up surfboard after decades catching waves
item.description: Seven decades ago when Kevin Merifield started exploring breaks in WA's South West, locals thought he was crazy braving the "shark-infested" waters to surf.

item.title: Tivoli Drive-In closes amid rising operating expenses and low attendance numbers
item.description: Rising expenses and poor weather are to blame for the closure of one of Queensland's last remaining drive-in cinemas.

item.title: Prominent neo-Nazi figure Joel Davis arrested in Sydney, group leader says
item.description: Joel Davis, who spoke at a rally outside NSW parliament earlier this month, was referred to the Australian Federal Police over a message about a Sydney MP.

item.title: Sanjeev Gupta's Liberty Bell Bay smelter could be further pursued by ASIC, even as Georgian bailout proposed
item.description: The manganese smelter in Tasmania has ore sitting untouched as Sanjeev Gupta turns to a Georgian company for a bailout, but an ASIC investigation looms.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Commissioner for Aboriginal Children and Young People to resign
item.description: Commissioner Meena Singh will step down from her role on Friday after three and a half years in the job.

item.title: Coalition would back Labor's environment laws with 'sensible' amendments
item.description: The opposition has identified seven key areas where change would be required for the Coalition to support Labor's proposed reforms to the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act.

item.title: The US has a fresh plan to end Russia's war in Ukraine. Here's what we know
item.description: European allies of Kyiv say "peace cannot be capitulation" as details of a new plan to end the Ukraine war emerge.

item.title: Princess Diana enters Paris waxwork museum in 'revenge dress'
item.description: The late Princess is displayed wearing a copy of the black gown by designer Christina Stambolian that she wore for a public appearance in 1994 amid a media frenzy about the breakdown of her marriage to Charles.

item.title: Trump floats death penalty for Democrats urging military to refuse illegal orders
item.description: Six Democratic politicians, all of whom are veterans, are urging members of the military not to obey unlawful orders.

item.title: More than 170 people rescued off Mount Semeru after eruption as 1,000 locals evacuated
item.description: Mount Semeru's sudden eruption left more than 170 people on its slopes in danger, while nearby residents fled for safety.

item.title: How Elon Musk's Cybertruck dreams quickly went pear-shaped
item.description: Elon Musk hinted at his dream for a battery-electric pick-up truck for years before, finally, on November 21, 2019, Tesla unveiled a prototype for its Cybertruck.

item.title: Our family made an emergency plan. Here’s how it went
item.description: I sat down with my family to make an emergency kit and an emergency plan. Here's how we did it and what we spent.

item.title: Boris Johnson oversaw 'chaotic' UK response to COVID that led to more deaths, inquiry finds
item.description: The inquiry's chair finds that more than 23,000 deaths could have been avoided had the British government acted sooner.

item.title: US honours Republican titan Dick Cheney, while Donald Trump and JD Vance not invited
item.description: Joe Biden, George Bush and every living former vice-president — Kamala Harris, Mike Pence, Al Gore and Dan Quayle — were in attendance, along with generals, foreign dignitaries and Supreme Court justices.

item.title: Virgin and Qantas to ban use of portable power banks after string of fires
item.description: Virgin Australia and Qantas will ban the use of portable power banks from next month following a string of international incidents.

item.title: How much will Tasmanians actually be paying for the stadium proposed for Hobart's Macquarie Point?
item.description: There are many questions still to be answered when it comes to how the stadium will be paid for.

item.title: How critical minerals power our daily lives from the moment we wake up
item.description: Take a tour around the house and see how everyday life is powered by critical minerals and why we will keep hearing so much about them.

item.title: Bulk-billing rates flatline, despite billions tipped into Medicare
item.description: Medicare figures quietly published online show bulk-billing has not improved from a year ago, despite billions being tipped into the scheme. As out-of-pocket costs rise, GPs are delivering 10,000 fewer services every day compared to last year.

item.title: The pre-Ashes chatter has been predictable. The cricket will be anything but
item.description: The build-up to this Ashes series has been long and often painful, but will quickly be forgotten when the first bowl is bowled and all hell breaks loose today.

item.title: Combating Neo-Nazis is a 'wicked problem' for governments
item.description: Neo-Nazis exploit feelings of alienation among a section of the community and making martyrs of them could play into their hands.

item.title: Australia's race to rewire the country amid a global transmission boom is not unique
item.description: Countries across the globe are racing to rewire their electricity systems for a decarbonised future. In Australia, delays are mounting, along with doubts about whether it can meet goals on schedule.

item.description: Tropical Cyclone Fina, currently packing sustained winds of 75 kilometres per hour near its centre, is expected to cause damaging wind gusts and heavy rainfall on the Top End coast today.

item.title: Alice Guo has been sentenced to life in prison for human trafficking in the Philippines
item.description: Former mayor Alice Guo has generated headlines for years in the Philippines. Now, her story might have come to an end.

item.title: Inquiry demands 'immediate' supply of clean drinking water for Aboriginal community contaminated by PFAS
item.description: An elder in an Aboriginal community exposed to PFAS contamination says the town is proof of the health risks of "forever chemicals", as a federal inquiry recommends widespread testing to establish a link.

item.title: Push for national approach to ADHD diagnoses as states forge different paths
item.description: As ADHD diagnoses rise, Australia's peak body for psychiatrists is calling for a national system to monitor and stop potential over-diagnosis of the condition.

item.title: Return of showers and storms as heatwave expands across Queensland
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says storm activity, expected mainly about the southern border area, is not forecast to be as intense as in previous weeks.

item.title: Five key takeaways from first week of child safety inquiry hearings in Brisbane
item.description: An inquiry into the state's "broken" child protection system hears from staff who work at the child safety department.

item.title: England captain Ben Stokes boasts his squad can defeat Australia in Ashes series
item.description: England captain Ben Stokes says he is not worried about his squad's lack of experience in Australia, adamant the players at his disposal can win the men's Ashes series.

item.title: The COP result is a Goldilocks outcome for the Albanese government
item.description: Türkiye is the big winner in the diplomatic stand-off over COP31, but nabbing the most powerful seat at the table while someone else picks up the lunch tab is not a bad result.

item.title: Federation University scraps one of Australia's oldest geology courses as students turn away from mining
item.description: Geoscience students are left feeling "in the dark" and "ripped off" as Federation University becomes the latest university to ditch its geology specialisation.

item.description: The opposition leader has accused Chris Bowen of being a "part-time energy minister" after he stuck a deal to take up a negotiator role for COP31.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he is ready to work on US-backed plan to end war in Ukraine

item.title: The smell is so bad in Kalgoorlie-Boulder, residents have given it a name and launched a petition
item.description: Kalgoorlie-Boulder residents launch a petition to have the city's wastewater treatment plant relocated as they continue to grapple with a smell so bad that some fear it will drive people away.

item.title: Meg Lanning scores stunning WBBL century as Stars record 111-run win over Sixers
item.description: Former Australia captain Meg Lanning hits her highest T20 score, as the Melbourne Stars hammer the Sydney Sixers by 111 runs.

item.description: "Wild" Wall Street sell-off triggers a sea of red on ASX. See how the trading day unfolded on our live blog.

item.title: Is Adelaide's stormwater contributing to the toxic algal bloom?
item.description: Adelaide's stormwater network has been discharging high loads of sediment into the Gulf of St Vincent for decades, killing off seagrasses that are a key defence against blooms of the kind wreaking havoc in South Australia.

item.title: Former Stone Roses and Primal Scream bassist Gary 'Mani' Mounfield dies aged 63
item.description: Mounfield was a member of the classic Stone Roses line-up for their 1989 self-titled debut album, which featured hits such as I Wanna Be Adored, She Bangs The Drums, and I Am The Resurrection.

item.title: Ashes debutant Brendan Doggett becomes fifth Indigenous player to represent Australia in Test cricket
item.description: When Brendan Doggett receives his cap today, he joins the sparse ranks of Indigenous Australian Test players.

item.description: A trial showing industrial hemp can be grown year-round has farmers excited about the crop's "huge" potential.

item.description: The premier faces one of his toughest challenges yet against the former television journalist-turned-CEO.

item.title: Rules meant to protect endangered gliders increase risk of localised extinction, scientists say
item.description: New data points to the "systemic" under-reporting of greater glider dens within areas earmarked for logging in NSW, which scientists say could result in localised extinctions.

item.description: With Tropical Cyclone Fina expected to make landfall on the Northern Territory coast late on Friday, residents of the remote communities in its path brace for expected destructive winds and heavy rainfall.

item.description: Montpellier responds to racism allegations made by Matildas forward Mary Fowler, who says a teammate gave her bananas as a departing gift in 2022.

item.description: A Perth doctor is suspended after disclosing confidential medical information about a patient and her baby to her estranged husband, despite knowing there was a domestic violence restraining order against him.

item.description: The Perth Test is finally upon us and the Ashes is about to get underway. Here is everything you need to know.

item.title: NT Corrections announces new approach to prisoner rehabilitation in shift 'from crisis to reform'
item.description: The officials who manage the Northern Territory's prison system say a new framework will replace a "fragmented" rehabilitation model that was not based on evidence, as the department moves "from crisis to reform".

item.description: Olympic gold medal-winning swimmer Kyle Chalmers is inspiring young and aspiring athletes, and speaking about the importance of mental health.

item.title: How Melbourne's journey to the preliminary final was forged in the fires of 2024

item.description: In a player-of-the-match performance, Ellie Carpenter sends Chelsea fans into a frenzy with a brilliant goal against European heavyweights Barcelona.

item.description: Tropical Cyclone Fina has been upgraded to a category two system, and is currently sitting just 40 kilometres north-west of Minjilang in West Arnhem Land.

item.description: Nicolas Kostowski is ordered to pay hundreds of thousands of dollars in compensation after pleading guilty to stealing 116 cattle from a neighbouring property.

item.description: Shopfronts were plastered with yellow closure orders this week by the Chief Health Officer, alerting the public to breaches of new laws.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Ben Stokes takes five-wicket haul as 19 wickets fall on day one of Perth Test
item.description: England captain Ben Stokes takes five late wickets as both batting line-ups fall to pieces on a frantic first day of the opening Ashes Test in Perth.

item.title: Money laundering network helping to fund Russia's war against Ukraine uncovered in the UK, police say
item.description: Britain's National Crime Agency says criminal cash has been funnelled through a bank in Kyrgyzstan, then on to Russia.

item.title: Disco proves a safe space for disability community in regional Queensland
item.description: Sean Pocock says he is still learning after 10 years of providing a space for people with disabilities to dance and socialise in a welcoming environment.

item.title: Trio behind deadly Wieambilla attack had 'shared delusional disorder' and were 'intent' on killing, coroner finds
item.description: A Queensland coroner has found two police officers who were killed by extremists were "adequately equipped" yet "no match for an ambush", as he made recommendations to prevent another tragedy.

item.title: 'Buying the dip has become a dangerous sport' as nervous global share markets dive
item.description: Global markets are nervous after more than $3.1 trillion was wiped off Wall Street last night in a matter of hours, with Australia's ASX following suit today. So, what's behind the dip, and do analysts expect it to continue?

item.title: Japan's new PM said the quiet part out loud on Taiwan and unleashed Beijing's fury
item.description: China was already wary about Japan's new Prime Minister, Sanae Takaichi, a renowned Beijing hawk, before she weighed in on one of its most sensitive issues: Taiwan. Now it's unleashing economic pain.

item.title: Tasmania's education regulator apologises to year 11 and 12 students as fourth error reported in TCE exams
item.description: Tasmanian Assessment, Standards and Certification apologises to students after a fourth error in this year's Tasmanian Certificate of Education exams comes to light.

item.title: Practice for F1 Las Vegas Grand Prix stopped twice, drivers unable to show true pace
item.description: Oscar Piastri has not been able to show his true pace in Las Vegas, with the second practice session on Friday being cut short for "track maintenance".

item.title: Chadwick Boseman, late star of Marvel's Black Panther, honoured with posthumous star on Hollywood Walk of Fame
item.description: Boseman, who played T'Challa in Marvel's Black Panther, died in 2020 at the age of 43 from colon cancer, which had been diagnosed previously.

item.title: Planned update to new Bureau of Meteorology website delayed by Tropical Cyclone Fina
item.description: The first major update to the maligned, redesigned Bureau of Meteorology website has been delayed by Cyclone Fina.

item.title: Man who caused Melbourne CBD evacuation jailed over 'homemade napalm' bombs
item.description: A bombmaker who created "homemade napalm" and whose arrest led to evacuations in Melbourne's CBD has been jailed for eight years.

item.title: Republican who called eSafety head a 'zealot' persists with call to testify
item.description: The powerful chair of a United States congressional committee who called in the head of Australia's internet regulator to testify before US Congress says he does not think foreign governments should be telling America about its "First Amendment liberties".

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: 'Big bang' over Kalgoorlie believed to be a meteor
item.description: A loud bang was heard in Kalgoorlie-Boulder on Thursday evening as a light quickly flashed across the sky.

item.title: Several residents across the Goldfields town heard a large 'bang'
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Pint-sized granny becomes face of Yandaran Hotel and a social media sensation
item.description: A pint-sized, pint-pouring granny becomes a social media star and the face of a country pub, as she adjusts from nursing to life behind the bar alongside her daughter.

item.title: Frida Kahlo painting sets new auction record for female artists
item.description: Mexican artist Frida Kahlo has become the most expensive female artist at auction, after her El sueno (la cama) painting sold for $US56 million.

item.title: Judy McCrow, says the recommendations come too late.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dozens of birds killed in suspected poisoning attack on the Gold Coast
item.description: Animal rescue group WIRES says its concerned about dogs and children who use the park after more than 30 birds were found dead from a suspected poisoning.

item.title: Teenager helps 92-year-old woman from burning property in Hunter region
item.description: A Hunter Valley teenager said he was just in the right place at the right time when he helped a 92-year-old woman to safety as her home was engulfed in flames.

item.title: Minjee Lee leads Australian trio four shots off the lead at LPGA's Tour Championship
item.description: Australians Minjee Lee, Grace Kim and Steph Kyriacou are all in the mix for a record $6.2 million pay day at women's golf's Tour Championship in Florida.

item.title: Star Entertainment $300 million rescue package approved by regulators
item.description: Under the deal, two US-based companies will own more than half of the embattled casino operator.

item.title: Australia's legal system grappling with growing number of sovereign citizens clogging up courts
item.description: Sovereign citizens are clogging up Australian courts, after the global financial crisis and COVID-19 spurred a surge in the group's numbers in Australia.

item.title: Varroa mite detected at Salt Creek, South Australia
item.description: The deadly bee parasite has been detected in South Australia again — this time in the state's south-east.

item.title: Queensland Police Union acting president Andy Williams speaks after the findings are handed down
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Murrumbidgee Local Health District to explore providing surgical abortions at Wagga Base Hospital
item.description: The Murrumbidgee Local Health District is exploring expanding reproductive health services so surgical abortions are available across a quarter of a million people in southern NSW.

item.title: WA musician Guy Ghouse dies, aged 56, after cancer battle
item.description: Western Australian musician Guy Ghouse dies at the age of 56 after a two year battle with cancer.

item.title: Health network boss apologises to Adelaide woman for spine surgery delays
item.description: An Adelaide woman says her elective surgery has been cancelled four times in the past few months as SA Health data shows nearly 25,000 people are waiting for elective surgeries across the state's public hospitals.

item.title: As Tropical Cyclone Fina nears, cyclone preparations in Darwin are underway
item.description: Darwin has hit fever pitch in its final preparations for the impending arrival of Cyclone Fina, with winding queues at petrol stations, bottle shops and the city's dump.

item.title: Man arrested over theft of car with sleeping child inside
item.description: Victorian police say a man has been arrested over the theft of a vehicle that had a sleeping toddler inside.

item.title: Former NSW CFMEU leaders, Darren Greenfield and son Michael, jailed over corruption
item.description: Former NSW union leaders, Michael Greenfield, and his son, Michael, have been sentenced to 10 months and six months in prison.

item.title: Fuel tanker racing to unload in Darwin ahead of Tropical Cyclone Fina
item.description: A fuel tanker is racing to unload diesel for the Northern Territory as Cyclone Fina approaches.

item.title: Adelaide Crows take Brisbane Lions dual-premiership player Callum Ah Chee in pre-season draft
item.description: Adelaide could not satisfy Brisbane in the AFL trade negotiations for Callum Ah Chee, but finally land the target through the pre-season draft.

item.title: Friday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Report finds $200 billion of Chinese credit pumped into Australia
item.description: A new study has revealed the scale of China's lending for projects and activities in Australia, with money poured into everything from tollways to supermarkets, wind farms and breweries — but mostly mining projects.

item.title: WA government commits further $147 million for new youth detention centre
item.description: The WA government pledges a further $147 million to fund the construction of a new youth detention centre in Perth to replace the notorious Unit 18.

item.title: Mitchell Starc registers career-best figures as England's 'unacceptable' batting style backfires
item.description: Mitchell Starc turns it on in the absence of Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood, as England's aggressive approach with the bat backfires spectacularly after Ben Stokes won the toss in the first Test.

item.title: Waste from Perth set to be trucked out to York after WA minister approves landfill site
item.description: The Western Australian environment minister has approved a new landfill site which will hold millions of cubic metres of waste trucked from Perth to a property near York.

item.title: Usman Khawaja criticised by Test greats for 'poor management' as back issues trigger little-known cricket rule
item.description: Usman Khawaja is criticised by several Australian Test greats after time off the field means he is forbidden from opening Australia's batting innings, exposing debutant Jake Weatherald.

item.title: Khawaja causes chaos, Starc and Stokes star as batters collapse — five quick hits from Ashes first Test day one
item.description: Usman Khawaja's toilet break causes top-order chaos as Ben Stokes and Mitchell Starc star with the ball. Here are the quick hits from the first day of the opening Ashes Test in Perth.

item.title: Former Reform UK politician Nathan Gill jailed for taking bribes from pro-Russians
item.description: Nathan Gill, a hard-right British former politician and one-time ally of Reform UK leader Nigel Farage, pleaded guilty earlier to eight counts of bribery between December 2018 and July 2019.

item.title: Toy Story turns 30: How Pixar's animated buddy comedy went to infinity and beyond
item.description: Toy Story made history as the world's first computer-animated feature film. As it celebrates 30 years, we look back on the cinematic hit that sparked a technological revolution.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says Ukraine faces choice of losing dignity or US backing
item.description: In a sombre address to Ukraine's citizens, the president vowed he would not betray Ukrainian interests in the US-led peace process.

item.title: Europe invests in military while Trump spruiks Ukraine 'peace plan'
item.description: Europe is pouring resources into military production and coordination which will impact its agency as well as that of the United States.

item.title: Coalition fends off One Nation as another Labor minister takes one for the team
item.description: Labor is trying to keep a low profile while the opposition fends off One Nation and Sussan Ley fights for her job.

item.title: European cars could become cheaper in EU trade deal
item.description: Australia and the European Union “edging closer” to a free trade deal and a luxury car tax is potentially on the table as a bargaining chip.

item.title: Behind the testimonials selling leg-lengthening surgery
item.description: Videos spruiking limb-lengthening are targeting the insecurities of young men, promising the luxury of height. The bone-breaking surgery comes with huge risks, and some botched procedures are being fixed in Australia.

item.title: Are those prawns really 100 per cent Australian? The mission to fight food fraud
item.description: As consumers, it's almost impossible to tell if a label on food is genuine. A small team of scientists are taking on this big problem.

item.title: Australia cops ominous Ashes warning as England responds to Mitchell Starc's excellence
item.description: Mitchell Starc's career-best day had Australia on track for a dream Ashes opening, only for England to offer back an ominous warning for the series ahead.

item.title: Away from COP30 and treaties, pragmatism sparks clean energy boom in the global south
item.description: Unshackled from legacy fossil fuel interests, the world’s clean energy future is being forged in the bustling cities of the global south.

item.title: Critically endangered orchid thrives as NSW Mid North Coast cemetery provides habitat refuge
item.description: Australian cemeteries have become a safe haven for flora and fauna affected by urban expansion, including a rare orchid unique to a small patch of the NSW Mid North Coast.

item.title: Bumpy's debut album Kanana connects country, language and cultural responsibility
item.description: Connecting language and country with culture and community, Bumpy's beautiful debut album is closing the gap through music.

item.title: ABC Quote Quiz: Nirvana's set list, a visitor from space, smashed avo and some unsuspecting prey
item.description: This week we have some choice words from Dave Grohl, a blob in the sky, a "wee dancer" and an unsuspecting bandicoot.

item.title: Storms will fire up over much of south-east Australia on Saturday, then contract to near the east coast and ranges on Sunday.

item.title: A heatwave will engulf much of central and north-east Australia this weekend and become extreme in much of inland Queensland.

item.description: Three major weather events are unfolding across Australia this weekend, with the assortment of intense weather set to impact several capitals.

item.description: Tropical Cyclone Fina, now a category two system, is currently packing sustained winds of 100 kilometres per hour near its centre and is impacting parts of the Tiwi Islands.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Fina could impact Darwin today with extreme weather conditions. Here's what you need to know
item.description: Tropical Cyclone Fina is approaching north of Darwin today, bringing with it some extreme weather conditions.

item.title: Cyclone Fina live updates: Storm intensifies to category three system as it moves towards Darwin
item.description: Tropical Cyclone Fina has intensified to a category three system as it moves towards Darwin. Follow live.

item.title: SA Parliament staff say their workplace is 'stuck in a time warp', report finds
item.description: Four and a half years after a landmark review into sexual harassment, South Australia's Parliament has been accused of moving at a "glacial pace" on workplace reforms, with a new report revealing staff concerns about power imbalances and a "deeply ingrained culture of favouritism".

item.title: Australia vows to launch Ashes fightback against England in Perth first Test
item.description: Australia is refusing to rule out a second-day comeback in the first men's Ashes Test, despite England decimating the host's batting line-up in Perth.

item.title: Rare parma wallabies moved to predator-free zones after 50 years in Blue Mountains sanctuary
item.description: The parma wallaby was thought to be extinct until Peter Pigott followed up on a rumour that a 19th century governor took a bunch of the mammals to New Zealand proved to be true.

item.title: English Premier League to introduce spending cap in 2026/27 season
item.description: Premier League clubs agree to the establishment of spending caps in England's top flight, beginning in the 2026/27 campaign.

item.title: Families of Wieambilla ambush victims say they are 'disappointed' by coronial inquest findings
item.description: The families of constables Matthew Arnold and Rachel McCrow, who died along with neighbour Alan Dare at the deadly 2022 ambush, had hoped for more.

item.title: Buyers' advocates criticise Victorian auction law requiring reserve prices to be advertised
item.description: Two buyer's advocates voice concerns about the Victorian government's proposal to stamp out underquoting at auctions.

item.title: Fears free public transport will put further strain on already packed regional trains
item.description: Victorians will benefit from free public transport on weekends this summer, but not all travellers are excited for the freebie.

item.title: First Hike Project helps refugees experience hiking in Australia's bushland for the first time
item.description: A community-led hiking program is introducing migrants to the bush, offering moments of connection, discovery and, for some, a sense of safety.

item.title: Targa Tasmania returns following major safety overhaul, as organisers look to bring back culture of enjoyment
item.description: The tarmac rally returned this year after a three-and-a-half-year hiatus and a major safety overhaul. Organisers say they want to focus more on participants enjoying their cars and the destinations.

item.title: Donald Trump praises Zohran Mamdani after cordial White House meeting
item.description: The US president and New York's mayor-elect present a united front at a warm and friendly press conference, even as reporters ask about their stark ideological differences and past attacks on one another.

item.title: Australian doctors visit rare PNG conjoined twins to assess options
item.description: A team of specialised doctors from Sydney has flown to Papua New Guinea to determine whether a rare set of conjoined twins can be surgically separated.

item.title: Pilot killed in Indian fighter jet crash during demo flight at Dubai Air Show
item.description: The Indian HAL Tejas, a combat aircraft used in the Indian Air Force, appeared to lose control and dive directly toward the ground just prior to crashing inside the grounds of the airfield.

item.title: Fake digital IDs pose new challenge for pubs and clubs
item.description: Once a one-off occurrence, publicans are now reporting "multiple per week" fake IDs.

item.title: Italy reaches Davis Cup final after defeating Belgium in Bologna semi
item.description: Italy's Flavio Cobolli shows class in comforting his Belgian opponent Zizou Bergs following a dramatic Davis Cup semifinal.
